38.text: The tenement is located approximately 900 km west of Alice Springs and can be reached by

39.text: vehicle  from  Alice  Springs  (about  10  hours  drive)  via  a  gravel  road;  or  in  2.5  hours  by  light

42.text: The tenement is situated in the WEBB 1:250,000 geology map sheets.

53.text: The  general  geology  of  the  Lake  Mackay  region  is  only  broadly  understood  because  of  the

54.text: area’s remoteness, extent of cover and the lack of previous exploration.  A geological report by

55.text: the Bureau of Mineral Resources (BMR) (Blake and Tower 1974), the Webb sheet geology by

56.text: Blake  (1977)  and  the  recently  acquired  aeromagnetics  data  (completed  by  the  Geological

57.text: Survey of Western Australia, 2006) provide a broad geological framework (Figure 4).

text:
The tenement is located approximately 900 km west of Alice Springs and can be reached by 
 vehicle  from  Alice  Springs  (about  10  hours  drive)  via  a  gravel  road;  or  in  2.5  hours  by  light 
 The tenement is situated in the WEBB 1:250,000 geology map sheets. 
 E80/3507 was granted on 9/11/2006 (70 BL) and is one of six exploration licences the company 
 The  general  geology  of  the  Lake  Mackay  region  is  only  broadly  understood  because  of  the 
 area’s remoteness, extent of cover and the lack of previous exploration.  A geological report by 
 the Bureau of Mineral Resources (BMR) (Blake and Tower 1974), the Webb sheet geology by 
 Blake  (1977)  and  the  recently  acquired  aeromagnetics  data  (completed  by  the  Geological 
 Survey of Western Australia, 2006) provide a broad geological framework (Figure 4).

17.text: There are no records of any previous exploration within E80/3507. In the Lake Mackay area in

18.text: general, exploration has been limited to work by BHP Ltd in the period 1996-2000.  The

19.text: exploration results included RC drilling intersection of 36m @ 0.42% Cu (BHP Ltd).

text:
There are no records of any previous exploration within E80/3507. In the Lake Mackay area in 
 general, exploration has been limited to work by BHP Ltd in the period 1996-2000.  The 
 exploration results included RC drilling intersection of 36m @ 0.42% Cu (BHP Ltd).  
 •  Reviewed existing magnetic, gravity and geological databases; 
 •  Commissioned ( November 2007) a remote sensing expert to undertake studies of 
 structural, lithological and regolith features of the project area and produce regional and 
 •  Negotiated and drafted an access agreement with the Aboriginal Land owners; and, 
 •  Planned first pass, reconnaissance, geochemical sampling and mapping programmes 
 including proposed access tracks for heritage clearance surveying (Figures 6 - 8).
